skill.name: Git Workflow Skill
skill.description: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and repository health checks.
skill.summary: Git workflow management including branch validation, commit conventions, PR preparation, and reposit...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation file containing Git workflow guidance. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variable access. This is a prompt-based skill providing conventions and patterns only.

content.value_statement: Git workflows require consistent conventions to maintain code quality. This skill enforces branch naming, conventional commits, and PR preparation for cleaner repositories.
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Requires user to run git commands manually
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems

use_cases.title: Maintain Clean History
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent commit messages and branch names for personal projects

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflow
use_cases.description: Establish branch strategies and PR templates across development teams

use_cases.title: Review Contribution Quality
use_cases.description: Validate incoming PRs follow project conventions before merge

prompt_templates.title: Create Feature Branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a feature branch for adding user authentication. Show me the correct branch naming format.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare Commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a conventional commit message for fixing the login bug in the auth module.

prompt_templates.title: PR Description
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a pull request description for my feature branch that adds user dashboard.

prompt_templates.title: Check Branch Status
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my current branch follows naming conventions and show me the status.

output_examples.input: Prepare a commit message for fixing the memory leak in the cache module
output: Generated commit template with conventional format ready to use

best_practices: Always create feature branches from main, never commit directly
Use conventional commit format for automated semantic versioning
Validate branch names match type/slug pattern before pushing
Run PR checklist before submitting for review
anti_patterns: Committing directly to main or develop branches
Using vague commit messages like 'fix' or 'update'

faq.question: Which git hosting platforms work with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and any git-based workflow. Conventions are platform-agnostic.

faq.question: What branch naming formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports feat/, fix/, docs/, refactor/, perf/, test/, chore/, hotfix/ prefixes with descriptive slugs.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides conventions and templates only. CI/CD integration requires separate configuration.

faq.question: Is my code or repository data accessed?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no file system, network, or code access.

faq.question: Why are my commits not following conventions?
faq.answer: Check branch names use correct prefix format. Commit messages must include type(scope): description format.

faq.question: How is this different from git hooks?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance via prompts. Git hooks enforce rules automatically during git operations.
